wikipedia_page.main: Edward Dusinberre (born 1968 in Leamington Spa, England) is a British violinist.

response: In 1993, Takács-Nagy left the group, and the British violinist Edward Dusinberre replaced him. In 1994, Ormai learned that he had incurable cancer, and was replaced by another British musician, violist Roger Tapping.  Following these changes, the quartet embarked on a successful series of recordings: a cycle of all six Bartók quartets (dedicated to the memory of Ormai, who died in 1995) and a critically acclaimed complete Beethoven quartet cycle, as well as quartets by Smetana and Borodin.
Edward Dusinberre, Beethoven for a later age, Faber and Faber 2016
* Edward Dusinberre - First violinist of the Takács Quartet

response: * Beethoven for a Later Age by Edward Dusinberre, read by Tim McMullan
